trigger_event: A surge of handwritten stories and personal memories floods the city’s networks, overwhelming the BCI as residents openly share their uncensored past across Memory Markets.
dilemma: Nikola must decide whether to use his authority to seal off and contain the spread of these untold stories, reasserting order—or to let memory flow freely, opening the gates to public voice and risking the BCI’s unraveling.
reason: Nikola’s lifelong commitment to quiet order clashes with the awakening of lost histories all around him. Conversations with Alex, the bartender—who questions whether rules are always right—echo in his mind, leaving him torn between reinforcing control and honoring the flood of memory that now defines the city’s mood.
choice_a: Seal off the Memory Markets by authorizing citywide lockdown on story-sharing, sending a message that order must prevail—even as tension simmers beneath the surface.
belief_a: Collective order requires boundaries, even at personal cost.
Letting chaos in risks permanent loss of stability.
Calm today is better than reckoning tomorrow.
choice_b: Open the gates and validate citizen storytelling, giving Memory Markets and the Shadow Ballot full legitimacy and allowing the city’s collective history to reshape BCI governance.
belief_b: Collective healing demands that all voices are heard, even if it brings unpredictability.
Suppression of memory only breeds deeper unrest.
Sometimes chaos is the only path to progress.
